alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 11 at 5:25PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...Water levels will be rising on creeks and streams in Inyo County this weekend through next week... The next round of warmer temperatures will start to accelerate snow melt along the eastern slopes of the southern Sierra this weekend through next week. All creeks, streams and rivers will experience higher flows that will likely continue through next week. As creeks, streams and rivers swell there will be the risk of minor flooding. All agencies have started taking steps to alleviate flooding as much as possible by clearing debris from channels and culverts, installing new and/or reinforcing existing infrastructure. As a precaution, some roads and campgrounds have already been closed. For your safety, obey all agency closures. Additional, Inyo National Forest Service campgrounds will be at risk of flooding. Roads used to access campgrounds and hiking trailheads will also be at risk of flooding. Remember, never drive through flooded roadways or around barricades. Pastureland or farmland adjacent to creeks, streams and rivers could experience areas of flooding, as well as a prolonged period of standing water. For further information on Inyo National Forest Campgrounds go to: fs.usda.gov/Internet/FSE_DOCUMENTS/fseprd486882.pdf Due to their swift currents and very cold water temperatures, creeks and streams pose life-threatening dangers. Extra caution should be exercised as exhaustion or unconsciousness from hypothermia could set in quickly. Always wear a properly fitted life jacket for all water activities. For further information on cold water go to: https://www.weather.gov/safety/coldwater

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Owens Valley
